item.title: The Unexpected Culprit In Leslie Preer's Murder
item.description:
Leslie Preer, a 49-year-old mother from Chevy Chase Maryland, was found murdered inside her home in May 2001 after she failed to show up for work; the case went unsolved for over two decades. Police collected DNA evidence at the scene that remained unmatched until 2022 when new forensic genetic genealogy tools identified a suspect.
Investigators traced the DNA to 45-year-old Eugene Teodor Gligor, who had dated Preer’s daughter years earlier; in June 2024 authorities arrested him after obtaining a DNA sample from a discarded water bottle at an airport that matched crime scene evidence.
